item.title: Meta Faces Italy Probe
item.description: Italy’s competition watchdog has opened an investigation into whether Meta has failed to provide adequate information on how to mark and monitor branded content on Instagram.

item.title: UK Retail Decline Raises Doubts Ahead of Key Shopping Season
item.description: Retail sales in the U.K. fell again in October, with wallets still squeezed by the high cost of living ahead of the all-important festive season.

item.title: LSE Announces Buyback, Sets Mid-Term Targets
item.description: London Stock Exchange said it planned to return £1 billion to shareholders over the next year, but analysts said its predicted lower-end revenue growth range for fiscal 2024 might be viewed negatively.

item.title: LSEG Shares at Risk on Lower-End Revenue Growth Forecast
item.description: London Stock Exchange predicted a lower-end revenue growth range for fiscal year 2024 without providing any quantitative figures, and the market could react negatively to this, Citi said.

item.title: USD/CNH's Pullback Has Likely Started, Charts Show
item.description: USD/CNH’s pullback has likely started, based on technical charts, said UOB Global Economics & Markets Research.

item.title: Eurozone Sovereigns' Net Cash Requirement in 2024 Seen at Record Level
item.description: Citi Research forecasts the net cash requirement of the eurozone’s largest 11 sovereign issuers at a record level of €542 billion in 2024, up 21% from €447 billion in 2023.

item.title: Generali Warns of Weaker Demand
item.description: Generali confirmed its targets until 2024 but said the insurance industry might be affected by weaker demand on signs of an economic slowdown, adding it planned to rebalance its life-insurance portfolio to boost profitability.

item.title: Avoiding China Has Been a Winning Investment Strategy. But It Isn't Easy.
item.description: Chinese stocks have diverged from the rest of the emerging markets, but the country is still weighing heavily on other economies.

item.title: As U.S. Wavers on Ukraine Aid, Europe Steps Up
item.description: EU powers are increasingly helping Kyiv hold the line against Russia as the war slips toward stalemate.

item.title: Singtel's Optus Sees No Precedent for Large-Scale Outage Compensation
item.description: Singapore Telecommunications-owned Optus has paid $23,299 in customer compensation following an hourslong Australia-wide network outage but said there is no precedent suggesting it should make widespread financial reparations.

item.title: Thousands of unionized Starbucks workers went on strike on a busy sales day for the coffee chain in a bid to bring the company back to the negotiating table.
item.description: Thousands of unionized Starbucks workers went on strike on a busy sales day for the coffee chain in a bid to bring the company back to the negotiating table.

item.title: An investigating prosecutor's report is expected to criticize Biden's handling of classified documents but the probe likely won't result in a criminal case, people familiar with the matter said.
item.description: An investigating prosecutor’s report is expected to criticize Biden’s handling of classified documents but the probe likely won’t result in a criminal case, people familiar with the matter said.

item.title: Retailers foresee U.S. price increases ebbing as more of them feel the sting of shoppers pulling back on purchases of discretionary items in response to tighter household budgets.
item.description: Retailers foresee U.S. price increases ebbing as more of them feel the sting of shoppers pulling back on purchases of discretionary items in response to tighter household budgets.

item.title: U.S. stocks ended mixed, with the S&P 500 rising 0.1% and the Nasdaq gaining slightly less than that. The Dow industrials fell about 0.1%.
item.description: U.S. stocks ended mixed, with the S&P 500 rising 0.1% and the Nasdaq gaining slightly less than that. The Dow industrials fell about 0.1%.

item.title: UAW employees at General Motors approved a new 4½ year labor contract, ending a tumultuous monthslong bargaining process by a slim margin of votes.
item.description: UAW employees at General Motors approved a new 4½ year labor contract, ending a tumultuous monthslong bargaining process by a slim margin of votes.

item.title: Apple plans to support a standard that will improve messaging with Android phones and enable new features.
item.description: Apple plans to support a standard that will improve messaging with Android phones and enable new features.

item.title: Inflation is falling faster than expected across advanced economies, marking a turning point in central banks' two-year battle against surging prices.
item.description: Inflation is falling faster than expected across advanced economies, marking a turning point in central banks’ two-year battle against surging prices.

item.title: The Israeli military released footage of a tunnel opening from within the largest hospital in Gaza, the first evidence to support its claims that Hamas's vast tunnel network runs underneath the medical facility.
item.description: The Israeli military released footage of a tunnel opening from within the largest hospital in Gaza, the first evidence to support its claims that Hamas’s vast tunnel network runs underneath the medical facility.

item.title: California authorities arrested a 50-year-old man in connection with the death of Jewish protester Paul Kessler during simultaneous pro-Israel and pro-Palestinian rallies earlier this month.
item.description: California authorities arrested a 50-year-old man in connection with the death of Jewish protester Paul Kessler during simultaneous pro-Israel and pro-Palestinian rallies earlier this month.

item.title: The House Ethics Committee said it found substantial evidence that Rep. George Santos stole money from his campaign and committed other misdeeds, igniting new calls for his immediate expulsion by colleagues and prompting the embattled lawmaker to say he won't run for re-election.
item.description: The House Ethics Committee said it found substantial evidence that Rep. George Santos stole money from his campaign and committed other misdeeds, igniting new calls for his immediate expulsion by colleagues and prompting the embattled lawmaker to say he won’t run for re-election.
